words.source: H1121 (בֵּן, 'son'), conjunction + noun common masculine plural construct; KJV 'And the sons of', ESV 'The sons of', NASB 'The sons of'
H8095 (שִׁמְעוֹן, 'Simeon'), proper noun; KJV/ESV/NASB all render 'Simeon'
H3223 (יְמוּאֵל, 'Jemuel'), proper noun; KJV 'Jemuel', ESV 'Jemuel', NASB 'Jemuel'
H3226 (יָמִין, 'Jamin'), conjunction + proper noun; KJV 'and Jamin', ESV 'Jamin', NASB 'Jamin'
H161 (אֹהַד, 'Ohad'), conjunction + proper noun; KJV 'and Ohad', ESV 'Ohad', NASB 'Ohad'
H3199 (יָכִין, 'Jachin'), conjunction + proper noun; KJV 'and Jachin', ESV 'Jachin', NASB 'Jachin'
H6714 (צֹחַר, 'Zohar'), conjunction + proper noun; KJV 'and Zohar', ESV 'Zohar', NASB 'Zohar'
H7586 (שָׁאוּל, 'Shaul/Saul'), conjunction + proper noun; KJV 'and Shaul', ESV 'and Shaul', NASB 'and Shaul'
H1121 (בֵּן, 'son'), noun common masculine singular construct; KJV 'the son of', ESV 'the son of', NASB 'the son of'
H3669 (כְּנַעֲנִי, 'Canaanite'), article + gentilic adjective feminine singular; KJV 'a Canaanitish woman', ESV 'a Canaanite woman', NASB 'a Canaanite woman'
H428 (אֵלֶּה, 'these'), demonstrative pronoun common plural; KJV 'these are', ESV 'these are', NASB 'these are'
H4940 (מִשְׁפָּחָה, 'clan/family'), noun common feminine plural construct; KJV 'the families of', ESV 'the clans of', NASB 'the families of'
H8095 (שִׁמְעוֹן, 'Simeon'), proper noun; KJV/ESV/NASB all render 'Simeon'
